1.name: Inland transport
1.desc: Transport by which goods are moved from or to the frontier, or between inland points.

2.name: At the statistical territory limit
2.desc: Point by which the means of transport are presumed to have left the statistical territory of despatch or to have entered the statistical territory of arrival.

10.name: Pre-carriage transport
10.desc: Transport by which the goods are moved prior to their main carriage transport.

11.name: At border
11.desc: Transport by which goods are moved to the Customs frontier.

12.name: At departure
12.desc: Transport by which goods are moved from the place of departure.

13.name: At destination
13.desc: Transport by which goods are moved at the place of destination.

14.name: At the statistical territory limit
14.desc: Transport by which the goods are presumed to have left the statistical territory of dispatch or have entered the statistical territory of arrival.

20.name: Main-carriage transport
20.desc: The primary stage in the movement of cargo from the point of origin to the intended destination.

21.name: Main carriage - first carrier
21.desc: The first carrier of the ordered transport when more than one carrier is involved.

22.name: Main carriage - second carrier
22.desc: The second carrier of the ordered transport when more than one carrier is involved.

23.name: Main carriage - third carrier
23.desc: The third carrier of the ordered transport when more than one carrier is involved.

30.name: On-carriage transport
30.desc: Transport by which the goods are moved after the main- carriage transport.
